009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
012
013/**
014 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2020/12/29
018 */
019public class Kernel2D {
020        
021        private final float[][] H;      // H[y][x] !!
022        private final int xc, yc;
023        private final int width, height;
024        
025        /**
026         * Constructor.
027         * Assumes that the kernel's structure is H[y][x] (i.e., vertical coordinate first)
028         * and the hot spot is at its center.
029         * The kernel is normalized by default.
030         * 
031         * @param H the 2D kernel array
032         */
033        public Kernel2D(float[][] H) {
034                this(H, (H[0].length - 1) / 2, (H.length - 1) / 2, true);
035        }
036        
037        /**
038         * Full constructor.
039         * Assumes that the kernel's structure is H[y][x] (i.e., vertical coordinate first),
040         * the hot spot position must be specified. 
041         * The kernel is optionally normalized.
042         * 
043         * @param H the 2D kernel array
044         * @param xc the x-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (width-1)/2
045         * @param yc the y-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (height-1)/2
046         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
047         */
048        public Kernel2D(float[][] H, int xc, int yc, boolean normalize) {
049                this.H = (normalize) ? normalize(H) : Matrix.duplicate(H);
050                this.width = H[0].length;
051                this.height = H.length;
052                this.xc = xc;
053                this.yc = yc;
054                validate();
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Creates the effective 2D kernel from two 1D kernels.
059         * 
060         * @param Hx the 1D kernel for the x-direction
061         * @param Hy the 1D kernel for the y-direction
062         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
063         */
064        public Kernel2D(Kernel1D Hx, Kernel1D Hy, boolean normalize) {
065                this(getEffectiveKernel(Hx, Hy), Hx.getXc(), Hy.getXc(), normalize);
066        }
067        
068        /**
069         * Calculates the effective 2D kernel array from two 1D kernels
070         * assumed to be applied in x- and y-direction, respectively.
071         * The result is not normalized.
072         * Use the constructor {@link #Kernel2D(Kernel1D, Kernel1D, boolean)}
073         * to create the equivalent (optionally normalized) 2D kernel.
074         * Note that the kernel coordinates are {@code H[y][x]}.
075         * 
076         * @param Hx the 1D kernel for the x-direction
077         * @param Hy the 1D kernel for the y-direction
078         * @return the effective 2D kernel matrix
079         */
080        public static float[][] getEffectiveKernel(Kernel1D Hx, Kernel1D Hy) {
081                float[] kernelX = Hx.getH();
082                float[] kernelY = Hy.getH();
083                
084                float[][] kernel = new float[kernelX.length][kernelY.length];
085                for (int y = 0; y < kernelY.length; y++) {
086                        for (int x = 0; x < kernelX.length; x++) {
087                                kernel[y][x] = kernelX[x] * kernelY[y];
088                        }
089                }
090                return kernel;
091        }
092        
093        private void validate() {
094                if (xc < 0 || yc < 0 || xc >= width || yc >= height) {
095                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("xc/yc is outside the filter kernel");
096                }
097                if (!Matrix.isRectangular(H)) {
098                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("filter kernel is not rectangular");
099                }
100        }
101        
102        /**
103         * Returns the kernel's 2D array.
104         * Note that the kernel coordinates are {@code H[y][x]}.
105         * @return the kernel's 2D array
106         */
107        public float[][] getH() {
108                return H;
109        }
110        
111        /**
112         * Returns the width of this kernel.
113         * @return the kernel's width
114         */
115        public int getWidth() {
116                return width;
117        }
118        
119        /**
120         * Returns the height of this kernel.
121         * @return the kernel's height
122         */
123        public int getHeight() {
124                return height;
125        }
126        
127        /**
128         * Returns the horizontal center coordinate of this kernel.
129         * @return the kernel's x-center coordinate
130         */
131        public int getXc() {
132                return xc;
133        }
134        
135        /**
136         * Returns the vertical center coordinate of this kernel.
137         * @return the kernel's y-center coordinate
138         */
139        public int getYc() {
140                return yc;
141        }
142        
143        // ----------------------------------------------------------
144        
145        /**
146         * Normalizes the specified array such that its sum becomes 1. Throws an
147         * exception if the array's sum is zero. The original array is not modified.
148         * 
149         * @param A a 2D array
150         * @return the normalized array
151         * @throws ArithmeticException if the array sums to zero
152         */
153        public static float[][] normalize(float[][] A) throws ArithmeticException {
154                float s = (float) (1.0 / Matrix.sum(A));
155                if (!Double.isFinite(s))
156                        throw new ArithmeticException("zero kernel sum, cannot normalize");
157                return Matrix.multiply(s, A);
158        }
159
160}
